availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin Butler (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of William G. Butler and Sarah Butler. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Private in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Calvarly Regiment (Confederate). Captured at Sparta, Tennessee,Prisoner of war from December 1862 to May 1863 and from July 1863 to February 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District No. 1, p. 165; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 122. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0033.
